title: 5-8-17 Mary Covey, Jennifer Rossotti, Linda Thielfoldt and Joan Ford  on Sloan's Talk show for American Patchwork and Quilting Radio
description:
Mary Covey is an author with the most recent books an array of super useful machine quilting design books. She has been longarm quilting for longer than I’ve been quilting, when hardly anyone knew what a longarm was. mary’s going to share with me how to think about adding the quilt designs and a big more!
 www.marycoveydesigns.com.
--------
When I found Jennifer Rossotti's site, Ginger Peach Studio, I loved her style! she takes amazing photos, creates gorgeous projects I want to make. Her sense of color and scales creates beautiful projects. Plus she love upsizing projects, my favorite thing! Listen in to find out how she is using glue in some unique ways for her projects!

http://gingerpeachstudio.com/
-------------
I’m delighted that Linda Thielfoldt is my quilt expert joining me in 2017. She is an award winning quilter, a teacher, designer, author and she quilts for hire too. With Linda’s deep technical knowledge of the quilt making process we are picking a topic each month and digging deep on it. This month we’ll talk about a group charity project Linda did with some friends and how you can do the same. FULL of great tips on running a charity project.

http://www.thequiltedgoose.com/
----------------
So glad to have Joan Ford of Hummingbird Highway back on the show! She is the creator of 'Scaptherapy' concept and her newest book celebrates how interesting the 9patch can be.  ‘The Versatile Nine Patch’ is overflowing with new ideas for using up your scraps! On the show today Joan shares tips for pressing directions and why that is super important. 
https://hummingbird-highway.com/ 
-------------

Visit host Pat Sloan at http://www.patsloan.com
